title: Thalia's AMALIA qualified on 12nm FinFET technology - Design and Reuse
summary: Thalia, an IP migration specialist, has qualified its AMALIA platform for 12nm FinFET technology, enabling customers to leverage advanced process technology for faster product development.  AMALIA is a software suite that simplifies the transition to newer technologies, reducing development time and maximizing business opportunities for semiconductor companies.  The AMALIA platform has a proven track record and has been validated on over 50 IPs, including those in RF, Baseband, PMIC, and PLL/ADC domains.

title: Increasing resilience of material supply by decentral urban factories and secondary raw materials - Frontiers
summary: This article proposes a new factory type called the Urban Secondary Raw Material Factory (USeRMaFa) to improve supply chain resilience in cities. The USeRMaFa would utilize local waste materials to create secondary raw materials for urban production, reducing reliance on global supply chains and promoting local circular economies. The paper discusses the potential benefits and challenges of this approach, focusing on technologies and process chains for plastic and metallic materials.

title: European Union launches second edition of Circular Economy Competition - GhanaWeb
summary: The European Union is hosting the second edition of the Circular Economy Competition in Ghana, aiming to support small businesses and start-ups promoting resource efficiency. The competition offers GHC 100,000 in seed funding for innovative circular economy projects, with a focus on making sustainable products and services accessible, affordable, and available to the Ghanaian public.

title: 33 things you need to know about Chris Skidmore's Net Zero Review - ENDS Report
summary: The UK government commissioned a Net Zero review, which outlines recommendations for achieving the UK's net-zero emissions target by 2050.  The review highlights the importance of long-term certainty, clear policy frameworks, and strategic investments in various sectors, including renewable energy, carbon capture and storage, and a circular economy.  Skidmore's report calls for a more coordinated approach to policy, increased public engagement, and a focus on supporting small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in their transition to net zero.
